comments.author: insider@t-k.ru
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.4b) Gecko/20030516 Mozilla Firebird/0.6
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.4b) Gecko/20030516 Mozilla Firebird/0.6

doesn't work with java plugin from sun's 1.4.1 SDK  doesn't recognize it as one

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.install jre 1.4.1
2.symlink the plugin into firebird's plugin directory
3.launch firebird

Actual Results:  
it did't see the plugin with the following messages
LoadPlugin: failed to initialize shared library
/usr/local/j2sdk1.4.1/jre/plugin/i386/mozilla/javaplugin_oji.so
[/usr/local/j2sdk1.4.1/jre/plugin/i386/mozilla/javaplugin_oji.so: undefined
symbol: _ZN16nsServiceManager23GetGlobalServiceManagerEPP17nsIServiceManager]


Expected Results:  
run happily
comments.text:

Reproducible: Always

Actual Results:

run happily
comments.creator: insider@t-k.ru

comments.author: hendikins@mozdev.org
comments.text:
Reporter: Did you build Firebird with gcc 3.x? Check about:buildconfig, and if
gcc3 is listed, please use the gcc 3.2.1 build of Blackdown JRE 1.4.1_01, or the
beta version of Sun's JRE 1.4.2 (which includes a plugin built with gcc3).

Also, please resolve this bug as INVALID if this is the case.
comments.raw_text:

comments.raw_text:
Mozilla Firebird I was using was built with gcc 2.96? and I was using the 3.2
version of the jre.
